p: Polymerases are enzymes essential for viral replication to produce viral progeny. Viral DNA and RNA polymerases are responsible for duplicating the viral genome and facilitating transcription and replication [ 103]. Replication inhibitors ( Figure 9(c)) interfere with the production of viral particles by blocking enzymatic activity, ultimately causing chain termination during viral DNA or RNA replication [ 166]. There are four types of viral polymerases in viruses: RNA-dependent RNA polymerases, RdRp, DNA-dependent RNA polymerases, and DNA-dependent DNA polymerases.
